Jasprit Bumrah abused with racial slur as Isa Guha calls him 'primate' on air - The Times of India
summary:
Jasprit Bumrah abused with racial slur as Isa Guha calls him 'primate' on air

Publication Date: NEW DELHI

Source: Times of India

Former England cricketer Isa Guha ignited controversy during commentary by referring to Indian bowler Jasprit Bumrah with a racially insensitive term on air, drawing backlash and comparisons to previous racist incidents in cricket.

  • During a commentary session on Day 2 of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, Guha called Bumrah a "primate".
  • Her remark followed praise from Brett Lee, who commended Bumrah's performance after he took two Australian wickets.
  • This incident drew comparisons to the 2008 'MonkeyGate' controversy involving Harbhajan Singh.
  • Bumrah's performance included the dismissal of Travis Head and Steve Smith, crucial wickets as Australia finished Day 2 at 405/7.
"Well, he's the MVP, isn't he? Most valuable primate, Jasprit Bumrah."

The commentary sparked significant outrage, highlighting ongoing issues of racism within the sport and igniting discussions about the responsibility of broadcasters and commentators in addressing sensitive topics.

India vs Australia: Matthew Hayden slams Marnus Labuschagne for losing focus after Mohammed Siraj's bail - The Times of India
summary:
India vs Australia: Matthew Hayden slams Marnus Labuschagne for losing focus after Mohammed Siraj's bail flip

Publication Date: NEW DELHI | Source: Times of India

Former Australia batter Matthew Hayden criticized Marnus Labuschagne for losing focus after Mohammed Siraj's playful antics during the Brisbane Test.

  • During Day 2 of the Brisbane Test, Siraj attempted to distract batsmen, notably flipping the bails at Labuschagne's end.
  • Labuschagne responded by switching the bails back, shortly before he was dismissed for 12 runs off 55 balls.
  • Hayden, commentating on Star Sports, emphasized that Labuschagne should have remained composed and not acknowledged Siraj's actions.
  • The five-match series is currently tied at 1-1.
"He saw 55 deliveries, has had no go forward whatsoever... if it was me at the crease and a bowler does that, I'm not even looking at the bowler." - Matthew Hayden

Hayden's comments highlight the importance of maintaining focus during intense matches, particularly in the competitive environment of Test cricket.

title: FIDE slams claims of Liren losing World Chess Championship match to Gukesh on purpose: 'Every sportsman makes mistakes' - Firstpost
summary:
FIDE slams claims of Liren losing World Chess Championship match to Gukesh on purpose: 'Every sportsman makes mistakes'

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: Firstpost

The International Chess Federation (FIDE) President Arkady Dvorkovich has dismissed allegations that Ding Liren lost the World Chess Championship match to D Gukesh intentionally, praising both players for their performances.

  • D Gukesh won the 2024 World Chess Championship, making him the second Indian champion after Viswanathan Anand.
  • Ding Liren made a critical blunder in Game 14, which cost him the match and title.
  • Vladimir Kramnik and the Russian Chess Federation raised doubts about the nature of Liren's loss.
  • Despite criticism from Magnus Carlsen, Viswanathan Anand supported Gukesh and encouraged him to disregard negative feedback.
  • Gukesh became the youngest-ever World Chess Champion at 18, breaking Garry Kasparov's record.
‚ÄúSports is about mistakes, without mistakes, there would be no goals in football. Every sportsman makes mistakes but that‚Äôs what we are excited about..." - Arkady Dvorkovich

In conclusion, the FIDE President's remarks highlight the unpredictability of chess, while Gukesh's historic victory continues to generate discussion and debate in the chess community.

The article discusses an unusual incident during the ongoing third Test match between India and Australia, where Mohammed Siraj and Marnus Labuschagne engaged in a playful bail-swapping act during the 33rd over, which resulted in Labuschagne's dismissal shortly thereafter.

title: Diljit Dosanjh talks about Allu Arjun's Pushpa; dedicates Chandigarh concert to chess world champion Gukesh. Watch - Hindustan Times
summary:
Diljit Dosanjh talks about Allu Arjun's Pushpa; dedicates Chandigarh concert to chess world champion Gukesh. Watch.

Date: Dec 15, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Singer Diljit Dosanjh dedicated his concert in Chandigarh to newly crowned chess world champion Gukesh D. He praised Allu Arjun's film Pushpa and shared his thoughts on both topics during the performance.

  • Diljit dedicated his Chandigarh concert to Gukesh, encouraging attendees with a motivational message.
  • Gukesh D. recently became the youngest FIDE World Champion after defeating China's Ding Liren.
  • Diljit watched Pushpa: The Rise but not its sequel, Pushpa 2: The Rule, and praised the film.
  • Pushpa 2 has become the highest-grossing Indian film of 2024, earning ‚Çπ1100 crore within nine days of its release.
  • Punjab CM Bhagwant Singh Mann's wife attended the concert; an advisory was issued to avoid alcohol-themed songs during the performance.
"Today's show is dedicated to world chess champion Gukesh. Do you know why it is dedicated to him? Because whatever you think in life, he has already thought about becoming a world champion. And he became that. Problems are there, I face them daily."

Overall, Diljit Dosanjh's concert highlighted both his admiration for Gukesh's achievements in chess and his appreciation for the film Pushpa, engaging the audience with inspirational messages and entertainment.
